results.title: The International Telecommunication Union
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Office of Public Information, Ramakantha Sarma and Krishna Singh
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United Nations: Its Charter and Organization”.
The conquest of time and distance in communications is one of the miracles of the modern age. Records the technological advances and growing co-operation among nations from the early pioneers to the latest spacecommunication satellites. The role of the International Telecommunication Union is emphasised particularly in the developing countries.

results.title: The International Court of Justice
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Office of Public Information, Janine Hamel-Minne and Karl Van der Ploeg
results.brief_description: The origin of the concept of international law and the evolvement of the role of the International Court of Justice in the Hague, in deciding legal disputes between States. Its work and function are illustrated in the controversy between Norway and the United Kingdom concerning fishing rights, the disputed frontier land between Belgium and the Netherlands, and the dispute between Cambodia and Thailand regarding the territorial sovereignty of a holy monastery.

results.title: The Interference of photons
results.creator_credit: Educational Services Incorporated and Physical Sciences Study Committee
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Presents an experiment at MIT in which light exhibits both particle and wave characteristics. Characteristic interference pattern is pointed out by many individual photons hitting at places consistent with the interference pattern.

results.title: The Intelligent animal
results.creator_credit: Granada International Productions and Jack Smith
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
One of a series of films using resources not available in the classroom. This is the introductory film to the series, and is a general outline of human anatomy and physiology.

results.title: The Insurance story. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Cine Service, Geoffrey Thompson and Eric L. Morris
results.brief_description: The birth and development of general insurance, the basic principles involved in its operation and the vital protective role that insurance plays in modern industrial and community life. Shows the work of a typical insurance office and the procedure which follows from a client’s claim after a fire.

results.title: The Insurance story
results.creator_credit: Cine Service, Geoffrey Thompson and Eric L. Morris
results.brief_description: Traces the history of insurance, origin of “underwriting”, and looks at the many fields in which insurance is available. Shows the work of a typical insurance office and the procedure following a claim. Narrated by Geoff McComas.

results.title: The Insulation story
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Katadotis and Les Krizsan
results.brief_description: Just as people need layers of clothing to keep warm, so houses need layers of padding to trap warm air and keep it inside as long as possible. The Insulation Story describes how you can get ready for a more comfortable winter with insulation, the not-so-magic formula. The film shows how much of the work can be done by the home-owner at reasonable cost.

results.title: The Instructional guide to dating
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Siobhan Bowers and Stuart Parkyn
results.brief_description:
There are many hazards to avoid in the airport of love. How do you choose a co-pilot to take on your journey? What is the best way to eject from a date that’s in a tailspin? How do you avoid excess emotional baggage?
The Instructional Guide to Dating is essential for every modern girl and hipster guy to navigate through the turbulent modern dating scene.

results.title: The Inspector general = Happy times
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Jerry Wald and Henry Koster
results.brief_description: An assistant elixir salesman (Danny Kaye) is mistaken by the Russian villagers of Brodny as the infamous Inspector General - an envoy of Napoleon. The tale’s comic impetus is driven by bungling officials seeking to appease the false general and the tongue twisting talents of the inimitable Danny Kaye. Cast includes Danny Kaye, Walter Slezak, Barbara Bates and Elsa Lanchester. Freely adapted from Nikolai Gogol’s classic Russian story.

results.title: The Insider [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Spyglass Entertainment, Eric Roth and Michael Mann
results.brief_description: From the opening scene, “The Insider” is a gripping and exhilarating thriller that investigates the corruption of journalist ethics. Russell Crowe gives an effective performance playing against type as Jeffrey Wigand, a paunchy middle-aged business man working for the tobacco industry who decides to blow the whistle on his colleagues’ attempts to hide the health risks associated with smoking. Al Pacino is the television journalist who takes on Jeffrey’s case but who finds that his own media executives refuse to support him. Based on the true story of when a tobacco industry whistleblower approached the US “Sixty Minutes” program, “The Insider” presents a cynical and disturbing case for how the increasing corporatisation of mass media leads to a denigration of the fifth estate’s objectivity and ethics. Michael Mann’s direction in this film is a critical leap for his own artistic career and the purpose and power of his vision is reflected in the high calibre of the support he receives from his cast and crew. The original music score is by Lisa Gerrard and Peter Bourke who are part of the musical group, Dead Can Dance. Cast also includes Christopher Plummer, Gina Gershon, Debi Mazer, Lindsay Crouse, Rip Torn and Philip Baker Hall.
